name: WatchGroup
comment: angular/angular.WatchGroup is a logical grouping of a set of watches. angular/angular.WatchGroups are organized into a hierarchical tree parent-children configuration. angular/angular.WatchGroup builds upon angular/change_detection.ChangeDetector and adds expression (field chains as in a.b.c) support as well as support function/closure/method (function invocation as in a.b()) watching.

context.name: context
context.comment: All Expressions are evaluated against a context object.

collectionCost.name: collectionCost
collectionCost.comment: STATS: Number of collection watchers which are in use including child angular/angular.WatchGroups.

evalCost.name: evalCost
evalCost.comment: STATS: Number of invocation watchers (closures/methods) which are in use.

fieldCost.name: fieldCost
fieldCost.comment: STATS: Number of field watchers which are in use including child angular/angular.WatchGroups.

totalEvalCost.name: totalEvalCost
totalEvalCost.comment: STATS: Number of invocation watchers which are in use including child angular/angular.WatchGroups.

addFieldWatch.name: addFieldWatch
addFieldWatch.comment:
Watch a angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFieldWatch.name field on angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFieldWatch.lhs represented by angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFieldWatch.expression.

  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFieldWatch.name the field to watch.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFieldWatch.lhs left-hand-side of the field.

addFunctionWatch.name: addFunctionWatch
addFunctionWatch.comment:
Watch a angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.fn function represented by an angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.expression.

  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.fn function to evaluate.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.argsAST list of angular/angular.ASTes which represent arguments passed to function.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.expression normalized expression used for caching.

  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addFunctionWatch.isPure A pure function is one which holds no internal state. This implies that the function is idempotent.

addMethodWatch.name: addMethodWatch
addMethodWatch.comment:
Watch a method angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.nameed represented by an angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.expression.

  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.lhs left-hand-side of the method.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.name name of the method.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.argsAST list of angular/angular.ASTes which represent arguments passed to method.
  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.addMethodWatch.expression normalized expression used for caching.

newGroup.name: newGroup
newGroup.comment:
Create a new child angular/angular.WatchGroup.

  • angular/angular.WatchGroup.newGroup.context if present the the child angular/angular.WatchGroup expressions will evaluate against the new angular/angular.WatchGroup.newGroup.context. If not present than child expressions will evaluate on same context allowing the reuse of the expression cache.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides angular/angular.WatchGroup.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and angular/angular.WatchGroup.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the angular/angular.WatchGroup.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
angular/angular.WatchGroup.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to angular/angular.WatchGroup.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If angular/angular.WatchGroup.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of angular/angular.WatchGroup.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
